response:
<<<api>>>: WeakHashMap and WeakReference
<<<code>>>: You can clear the key and value of instanceMap automatically by using a WeakReference to the Conf object in the HashMap. This way, when the Conf object is garbage collected, its reference in the HashMap will also be garbage collected, and the key and value will be automatically removed from the HashMap.
Here's an example:
```
class Conf {
    private static HashMap<String, Conf> instanceMap = new HashMap<String, Conf>();
    /*     * Below code will avoid two threads are requesting      * to create conference with same confID.     */
    public static Conf getInstance(String confID){
        //This below synch will ensure singleTon created per confID
        synchronized(Conf.Class) {
            Conf conf = instanceMap.get(confID);
            if(conf == null) {
                conf = new Conf();
                instanceMap.put(confID, conf);
            }
            return conf;
        }
    }
}
```
You can also use the `weakHashMap()` method from the `java.util.WeakHashMap` class to create a weak map, which will automatically remove the key and value when the key (i.e. the Conf object) is garbage collected.
```
class Conf {
    private static WeakHashMap<String, Conf> instanceMap = new WeakHashMap<>();
    /*     * Below code will avoid two threads are requesting      * to create conference with same confID.     */
    public static Conf getInstance(String confID){
        //This below synch will ensure singleTon created per confID
        Conf conf = instanceMap.get(confID);
        if(conf == null) {
            conf = new Conf();
            instanceMap.put(confID, conf);
        }
        return conf;
    }
}
```
It's important to note that the key in a WeakHashMap must not be null, otherwise the HashMap will throw a NullPointerException.
